intro: Spiesia gymnogyne, commonly known as the common thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has spiny leaves and produces purple or pink flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and roadsides. Spiesia gymnogyne is known for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in herbal remedies.
